data.description:
* Use your Gear VR Controller for real disc throwing action *

A fast paced, physics based, game of throwing glowing discs at each other.
Play against others online or on local network.
Single player includes League Challenge where you compete with several other teams through 4 major competitions.
For a real challenge try "hard" and "iron man" modes to play 1v2 or 1v3!

Play with Gear VR Controller, many Bluetooth controllers or the touchpad.

In Disc League each competitor possesses a powered disc. This disc can be thrown at opponents to score points. The disc can also be used to defend against enemy discs. At any time you can recall your disc and direct its movement mid-flight. Try using the right analog stick to precisely block or to add curvature to your throws. This can also be done using touchpad by pressing and holding touchpad during a throw or block.

By combining curves, wall bounces, and recall there are many different strategies to discover.

changelog.change_log:
Motion Controller Fixes and Tuning (proper left hand support)
Fixes for Oculus Rooms and online play

- significant improvements to throw curving
- easier to throw curves with motion controller
- fixes for gaze targeting (curves are much more accurate now)
- left handers now have disc throwing in left hand
- other fixes

Gear VR Controller Support
- Now play Disc League the way it was meant to be played -

3 Aim Assist Modes
- Auto Targeting - (Beginners) automatically aim at enemies
- Gaze Targeting - (Gamers) aim where you look, can do all moves
- Free Aim Mode - (Sporting) complete freedom in your throws, takes some practice

Voice Chat and Audio Options (v0.7.5)
The release features Voice Chat along with some audio and dance options.
... note that Voice Chat requires head phones ...

New Options Added
- Voice Chat On/Off
- Music On/Off (plus half and quarter volume choices)
- Crowd On/Off (plus half and quarter volume choices)
- Dance 3rd/1st person option (allows you to stay in 1st person during celebration)

Gameplay Tuning Update (v0.7.4)
This update primarily consists of gameplay tuning requests from players.

Features and Fixes
- Re-position players at beginning of each round
- Push Kick (applies a strong force on contact and stuns opponent but does not award point)
- For comfort, pop to a 3rd person camera while doing celebration dance
- Store camera preference (e.g. stay in 1st person view between matches)
- Throw Timer Display (displayed on crosshair to help time release of throw)
- Practice Mode Active Opponent (now can practice against stationary or active opponent)
- other cleanup

Support for XBox One S Controller
Fix for multiplayer connectivity issue
Fix for rare single player crash
Optimized build with new back button flow in game and UI clipping fixes.

Release Candidate (latest from Alpha/Beta channels)

plus small fix for UI clipping into arena issue

LAN Gameplay and support for Oculus Rooms!

Major Features
- LAN gaming support up to 4 players (1v1, 2v1, 2v2)
- Upgrade to Oculus SDK 1.8
- Support for Oculus Rooms

Minor Updates
- Stage selection
- Basic player statistics (hits, blocks, etc)
- Various optimizations for networked gameplay
- Some new UI (Rematch screen, you're out screen, networking)
- Auto team balance
- Better controller detection

Known Issues
- Disc throw release timing across network is still being tuned (can sometimes cause funny disc flight)
- Kick (melee) is not perfectly synchronized across network, will sometimes cause state to desync
--- can simply kick enemy multiple times to remedy this :)  - a real fix is on the way
- Support for internet games has been disabled, still a work in progress

Fix package name in Manifest file

Major Features
- 2v2 Gameplay (vs AI)
- New Characters (2 uniforms, 3 helmets)

Minor Features and Fixes
- More aggressive AI
- Player indicator
- Improved loading time (with loading screens)
- Standard Gear VR features (Volume UI, Universal Menu, Back Button, Controller check)
- Other small gameplay and UI fixes
